About Saju Guide

Bridging ancient Korean wisdom with modern understanding

Our Mission

Korean Saju Guide was created with a simple yet profound mission: to share the fascinating cultural tradition of Saju (사주/四柱) with English-speaking audiences around the world. We believe that this ancient system of self-understanding deserves to be explored, appreciated, and respected as a valuable part of Korean cultural heritage.

What We Offer

Our platform provides educational resources and interactive tools that help you explore the world of Korean Four Pillars:

  • Saju Calculator: Generate your personal Four Pillars chart based on your birth information
  • Compatibility Tool: Explore relationship dynamics through the lens of Saju
  • Educational Guides: In-depth articles explaining concepts like the Five Elements, Heavenly Stems, Earthly Branches, and more

Our Approach

We approach Saju with respect for its cultural origins and an understanding of its proper context:

  • Cultural Education: We present Saju as a traditional knowledge system, not as fortune-telling or supernatural prediction
  • Self-Reflection: Our tools are designed to encourage personal insight and growth, not deterministic life decisions
  • Privacy-First: All calculations happen in your browser—we never store your personal birth data
  • Transparency: We're clear about what Saju can and cannot do

Cultural Context

Saju has been practiced in Korea for centuries, with roots tracing back to Chinese philosophical traditions. It's a system that combines cosmological principles, temporal cycles, and the theory of Five Elements to create a framework for understanding personality traits, life patterns, and interpersonal dynamics.

In modern Korea, Saju remains a popular form of cultural practice, often consulted for personal reflection, relationship insights, and life transitions. We aim to present this tradition authentically while making it accessible to international audiences.

Important Disclaimer

For Entertainment & Self-Reflection Only

The content and tools on this website are provided for entertainment, cultural education, and personal reflection purposes only. They are not intended to provide professional advice of any kind—medical, legal, financial, psychological, or otherwise. Saju readings should not be used as the basis for important life decisions. We encourage you to enjoy exploring this cultural tradition while maintaining a healthy perspective on its role in modern life.

Contact Us

Have questions, suggestions, or feedback? We'd love to hear from you. Visit our Contact page to get in touch.

⚠️ Entertainment & Self-Reflection Only: The information provided on this site is for cultural education and entertainment purposes only. It is not a substitute for professional medical, legal, psychological, or financial advice.
